title: Rachel Alvarado
text: Welcome to my website! My name is Rachel Alvarado and I am a fourth year Environmental Studies major attending UC Santa Barbara. I am interested in habitat conservation and environmental consulting and I intend to work with the city of Los Angeles upon graduating. This webpage showcases my studies, experience, and extracurriculars. This website is continuously updated to encompass my increasing accomplishments and interests.

title: Rachel Alvarado

title: Education
text:
University of California, Santa Barbara


Sep 2022 – Jun 2025


Bachelor of Science



Cumulative GPA: 3.7 (Honors/Cum Laude)



Description: Your description goes here.


[Small Image]


Santa Monica College


Sep 2020 – May 2022


Associate’s Degree



Cumulative GPA: 3.5 (Honors/Cum Laude)



Description: Most of my time during community college was during quarantine.


[Small Image]


International Christian University


March 2024 – June 2024


Study Abroad Program


Description: Participated in a trimester-long study abroad program at International Christian University (ICU) in Tokyo, Japan. Engaged in courses within the liberal arts curriculum, enhancing cross-cultural communication skills and gaining exposure to Japanese academic and cultural environments. The program emphasized bilingual education and offered opportunities to interact with a diverse international student body.


[Small Images]


Notable Coursework


Renewable Energy Systems – UCSB



Examining economic policies


Energy storage


Wind, solar, tidal, geothermal energy systems



Green Building – UCSB



Systems to reduce energy demand


Implementing renewable energy and materials


Cost implications


Analyzing energy efficient systems



Geographic Information System (GIS) – UCSB



Capture, manage, analyze, and share spatial data


Create maps based on findings


Windows proficiency


Generate clear spatial questions



Environmental Statistics – UCSB



Understand basic probability and statistics


Select statistical analyses for hypotheses


Analyze and visualize data using R coding


Ensure reproducibility and collaboration


Interpret results in environmental contexts



Engineering and Environmental Geology – UCSB



Recording and analyzing aerial imagery


Analyzing fire, flood, air quality hazards


Analyzing and plotting water level data


Examining oil well safety


Reporting and presenting findings



Biology Laboratory – Los Angeles Community College



Microscope proficiency


Animal behavior


Osmosis and diffusion


Cellular respiration


Gel electrophoresis



Conservation Planning – UCSB



Developing conservation plans for different species and ecosystems


Miradi profficiency


Fundamental objectives charts and webs


Working with Northern Chumash Council tribe for erosion control
